title: Are you gay? When did you know? - Quora

response.answer_text: There is no one way that gay people act or look – gay people are just as diverse as straight people. Just because you are a man who is effeminate or a woman who is boyish, that does not mean that you're necessarily gay. So don't fall into the trap of thinking that your clothes, hair or attitude determines your sexuality. When looking at the signs you are gay, you might want to ask yourself these questions: Have I ever been sexually attracted to the same sex?Do I feel strong emotional bonds to the same sex?Am I physically attracted to the same sex?Have I considered having a sexual relationship with someone of the same sex?Have I had sexual same-sex experiences in the past?With that being said, I discovered myself really in the 8th grade. Long story, but here we go. There was this field trip we took at the end of the year in 8th grade to a local theme park. We wouldn’t come home until about 2 in the morning. My mom told me before my schoolmates left on the trip that she’s fine with me staying at one of my friends houses. My gay friend (of course she didn’t know that). I didn’t necessarily expect anything to “go down” that night. Was I worried about it? Not really. I had a girlfriend at the time. I wasn’t so much attracted to her sexually, not even really her looks. I was just dating her to hide my sexuality, because I felt it was obvious that I was gay-curious. Anyway, at about 2 AM that night, I woke up to my friend masturbating. Rather intrigued, and in the position I was in, I watched him, and he didn’t notice me for about 5 minutes. Of course I had to sneeze, which happened. Long story short, I had sex with a boy, which helped me figure out Im gay. I am not promoting unsafe sexual intercourse, nor am I saying that it is the only way to discover yourself.

I’ve known that I am gay since kindergarten. Yes, I know! CRAZY right? well, it did feel weird liking a boy in kindergarten. A beautiful little boy, brown hair, white skin, freckles, and a cute laugh. I had these types of feelings in kindergarten but I didn’t tell anyone. Only because I felt that I already didn’t fit in and I was going to get in trouble for liking someone or something like that. Me and him used to put on princess dresses and wear the plastic princess heels as a joke and we used to laugh all day together. We were best friends til 3rd grade when I left the school. fast forward now, a couple months ago the same guy I had a crush on, whom I haven’t seen in 5 years, texted me, asking me if I was gay. I didn’t know what to say, but I denied it. Only because I wasn’t out at the time, and even if we are far from each other, I’d rather not have my old friends hear it. I’m proud of myself, me being gay, and I wouldn’t change it. There are just times you don’t let everyone in on your business.
